exampleProjects.name: Cisco - Meraki - REST - Example
exampleProjects.webName: Cisco Meraki Example Use Cases for Device Provisioning
exampleProjects.overview: This Pre-Built Automation bundle contains several example use cases that are applicable when Itential Automation Platform is integrated with a Cisco Meraki controller using the REST API

capabilities.capability: The workflow is used to create an organization network

inputs.name: adapterId
inputs.description: The Meraki adapter instance to use in job

inputs.name: networkName
inputs.description: The name of the new organization network

inputs.name: tags
inputs.description: Space separated list of tags to be applied to the network

inputs.name: type
inputs.description: Space separated list of the product type(s) of the new network. If more than one type is included, the network will be a combined network.

inputs.name: disableMyMerakiCom
inputs.description: If set to true will disable mymeraki.com

inputs.name: disableRemoteStatusPage
inputs.description: If set to true will disable the remote status page

inputs.name: organizationName
inputs.description: Name of the organization within which to create network in Meraki

outputs.name: createNetworkSuccess
outputs.description: Result of creating network in Meraki

outputs.name: createNetworkError
outputs.description: Result if failure creating network in Meraki
outputs.exampleValue: {   "icode": "AD.500",   "IAPerror": {     "origin": "meraki-connectorRest-handleEndResponse",     "displayString": "Error 400 received on request",     "recommendation": "Verify the request is accurate via debug logs and postman",     "code": 400,     "raw_response": {       "status": "success",       "code": 400,       "response": {         "errors": [           "Name has already been taken"         ]       },       "redirects": 0,       "tripTime": "325ms"     }   },   "response": {     "errors": [       "Name has already been taken"     ]   } }

relatedDocumentation.name: Create Organization Network - Meraki
relatedDocumentation.description: Meraki API documentation for creating an organization network

exampleInputsAndOutputs.exampleInput:
{
  "adapterId": "Meraki",
  "networkName": "Network Already Exists",
  "timeZone": "America/New_York",
  "tags": "tag1 tag2",
  "type": "appliance switch wireless",
  "disableMyMerakiCom": true,
  "disableRemoteStatusPage": false,
  "organizationName": "Organization"
}

name: Create Network - Meraki - REST
overview: This is a modular workflow that automates the creation of a new network.
